sentence.Network_en: In the 50s, Rauschenberg anticipated the conceptual art movement of the 80s.
sentence.Network_cn: 上世纪50年代时，劳申伯格就早早地预见到了80年代的概念艺术运动。

sentence.Network_en: The dimensions of the market collapse were certainly not anticipated.
sentence.Network_cn: 股市崩盘的严重程度的确是没有预料到的。

sentence.Network_en: The long-anticipated study drew criticism from the tobacco industry.
sentence.Network_cn: 让人期待已久的研究遭到了烟草行业的批评。

entry.def: If an event, especially a cultural event, is eagerly anticipated, people expect that it will be very good, exciting, or interesting.

example.ex: ...the most eagerly anticipated rock event of the year.
example.tran: 最让人殷切期盼的年度摇滚乐盛事

example.ex: ...one of the conference's most keenly anticipated debates...
example.tran: 这次大会中受到最热烈期待的辩论之一

auth_sentence.content: Yet those eagerly anticipated school trips are under threat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet those eagerly anticipated school trips are under threat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet those eagerly anticipated school trips are under threat.

auth_sentence.content: They have come at double the rate we anticipated.
auth_sentence.res_content: They have come at double the rate we anticipated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They have come at double the rate we anticipated.

auth_sentence.content: We anticipated that there may be concerns and questions.
auth_sentence.res_content: We anticipated that there may be concerns and questions.

Sentence.sentence: Decades ago, Kodak anticipated that digital photography would overtake film — and in fact, Kodak invented the first digital camera in 1975 — but in a fateful decision, the company chose to shelf its new discovery to focus on its traditional film business.

Although Kodak anticipated the inevitable rise of digital photography, its corporate（企业的） culture was too rooted in the successes of the past for it to make the clean break necessary to fully embrace the future
The report from the Bureau of Labor Statistics was just as gloomy as anticipated.
With production anticipated to increase by 25% between now and 2030, sustainable energy sourcing will become an increasingly major issue

This means that there could be an extra three billion mouths to feed by the end of the century, a period in which substantial changes are anticipated in the wealth, calorie intake and dietary preferences of people in developing countries across the world.
